Question: What is UTE’s vision and mission?
Answer: Our Vision: To ascend Cambodia’s graduates to the highest caliber in academic and professional development. Our Mission: To cultivate the next generation of visionary graduates, innovative entrepreneurs, and ethical individuals through internationally acclaimed qualifications.

Question: Where is UTE located?
Answer: #39A-39B, Street 592, Phum 10, Sangkat Boeung Kak 2, Khan Toul Kork, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. [https://maps.app.goo.gl/C3tLyvx6mx6mqcc58]

Question: How can I contact UTE?
Answer: You can reach us via email at [info@ute.ac], phone at [+85517/70 592 888], or through our official website [www.ute.ac]. Facebook Page: [facebook.com/ute.officialkh] and Telegram: [@uteadmission]

Question: What is special about UTE?
Answer: UTE offers not only an education degree but a readiness program for life and future jobs.

Question: How do I apply for admission to UTE?
Answer: Applications can be submitted online through the UTE admissions portal at [https://ute.ac/student-admission-form]. Detailed steps and requirements are listed there.

Question: What are the admission requirements?
Answer: Requirements vary by program, but generally for undergraduate programs include: (1) Completion of the Bac. II (Grade 12) or equivalent certificate. (2) IELTS 5.5 or equivalent. (3) If there is no recognized English proficiency certificate, students have to complete the UTE/Cambridge English Placement Test (CEPT). The placement test fee is 10$ and will be refunded when the student enrolls at UTE. (4) Pass the interview or exam on critical. thinking/problem-solving skills

Question: When are the application deadlines?
Answer: Deadlines differ by semester and program. Please check the admissions calendar or contact us directly at the address above.

Question: What programs does UTE offer?
Answer: UTE currently offers professional certificate programs and Undergraduate Honors Degree programs: (1) BA (Hons) in Business Management and Entrepreneurship (2) BSc (Hons) in Computer Science (specialized skills in cyber security, software engineering, and AI and Data Analytics) (3) BSc (Hons) in Digital Marketing (4) BSc (Hons) in Architecture and Urban Planning (5) BSc (Hons) in Interior Design

Question: How can I access course materials?
Answer: Students can log in to the UTE Learning Management System (LMS) with their university credentials to access class materials, assignments, and grades. There, they can communicate with their peer and professors. For further information about LMS, please visit: [ lms.ute.ac ]

Question: What’s the EAS Program?
Answer: The English for Academic Success (EAS) program at UTE is designed to prepare students for success in an academic environment where English is the primary language of instruction. Students typically learn academic writing, reading, listening, and presentation skills. Research methods and other skills will also be taught in this program.

Question: What student support services are available?
Answer: UTE provides academic advising, counseling, career services, and tutoring for all students.

Question: Are there student clubs and organizations?
Answer: Yes! UTE has the elected Student Senate and a wide range of student-run organizations, including cultural, academic, professional, and recreational clubs.

Question: Can I visit the campus before applying?
Answer: Yes. You can visit the UTE campus before applying. Campus visits are a great way to get a feel for the environment, meet faculty or current students, and see the facilities firsthand. Contact us at admission@ute.ac or phone 070 592 888.

Question: Is there any opportunity to do an exchange program abroad?
Answer: Yes, UTE collaborates with many partners organizations in the world. You will have the opportunity to visit our partners through various programs such as student exchange, field visit, study tours, industrial placement, etc.

Question: How much is tuition at UTE?
Answer: Tuition varies by program and residency status. Current tuition and fee schedules are available on the UTE finance office. Contact us for more information on this.

Question: Is financial aid available?
Answer: Yes, UTE offers scholarships, grants, work-study, and loan programs. Students can apply through the Financial Aid Office.

Question: What types of scholarships are available?
Answer: UTE offers several types of scholarships based on our Scholarship Policy to support students in their academic journey. These scholarships are designed to recognize and reward various qualities and achievements, such as Merit-Based, Need-Based, Talent-Based, and Leadership Scholarships. To apply for a scholarship, please fill in our application form [https://ute.ac/student-admission-form/]

Question: Does the scholarship cover the full tuition fee?
Answer: Yes, some UTE scholarships can cover up to 100% of the tuition fee, depending on the type of scholarship and the applicant’s eligibility. Other scholarships may cover partial tuition or specific costs, so it’s important to check the details of each scholarship program.

Question: How do I access my student email?
Answer: Every student is given a UTE email account upon enrollment. Log-in credentials will be given with a sealed envelope.

Question: Who do I contact for technical support?
Answer: Support is offered for email, LMS, Wi-Fi, and software issues.\nThe IT Help Desk is available at itsupport@ute.ac

Question: How can I stay connected as an alumnus?
Answer: Alumni can join the UTE Alumni Association, attend events, and stay updated through newsletters and social media.

Question: Does UTE offer career services?
Answer: Yes, the Career Services Center provides job search resources, resume reviews, interview prep, and career fairs. Each of the undergraduate programs comes along with a career readiness project.
